source.name: City of Vancouver / Recycle BC
source.notes: Based on City of Vancouver and Recycle BC curbside guidelines. Flexible plastics and foam must go to depot (not curbside). GFL Environmental handles collection.

materials.name: Newspapers
notes: Part of Recycle BC paper stream
commonMistakes: Don't bundle with string or put in plastic bags

materials.name: Magazines and catalogues
commonMistakes: Remove plastic wrap before recycling

materials.name: Office paper and mail
notes: Shredded paper: place in paper bag, then blue box
commonMistakes: Don't include laminated paper

materials.name: Cardboard
instructions: Place in or beside blue box
notes: Leave 1 metre between recycling and garbage for collection
Must be out by 7 AM; GFL Environmental collects: 604-282-7966
commonMistakes: Don't include wax-coated cardboard
Pieces larger than 76cm x 76cm won't be collected

materials.name: Paperboard boxes
instructions: Flatten and place in blue box
commonMistakes: Don't include wax-coated boxes (e.g., some frozen food boxes)

materials.name: Paper bags
instructions: Flatten and place in blue box
commonMistakes: Food-soiled bags go in green bin

materials.name: Milk and juice cartons
notes: Gable-top and aseptic (Tetra Pak) cartons accepted
commonMistakes: Don't flatten; leave in 3D shape

materials.name: Plastic bottles
commonMistakes: Don't include bottles with liquid in them

materials.name: Plastic tubs and containers
commonMistakes: No foam containers; foam goes to depot

materials.name: Metal food cans
commonMistakes: Don't include cans with food residue

materials.name: Beverage cans
notes: Deposit refund available at bottle depots
commonMistakes: Don't crush cans

materials.name: Glass bottles and jars
notes: Glass accepted in Vancouver curbside recycling
commonMistakes: Don't include broken glass; wrap and place in garbage
Don't include window glass, mirrors, or ceramics

materials.name: Aluminum foil and trays
commonMistakes: Don't recycle heavily soiled foil; that goes in garbage

materials.name: Empty aerosol cans
commonMistakes: Don't recycle if still pressurized

materials.name: Metal lids and caps
commonMistakes: Remove from glass jars before recycling glass

materials.name: Plastic bags, film, and overwrap
instructions: NOT accepted in curbside blue box
Take to a Recycle BC depot for recycling
Many grocery stores also accept clean plastic bags
notes: Flexible plastics jam curbside sorting equipment
Vancouver requires depot drop-off for all plastic film
commonMistakes: Don't put in blue box; take to depot
Don't use plastic bags to bundle recyclables

materials.name: Foam packaging (styrofoam)
instructions: NOT accepted in curbside blue box
Take to a Recycle BC depot
notes: Vancouver does not accept foam in curbside recycling
commonMistakes: Don't put in blue box or garbage if recyclable at depot

materials.name: Food waste (all types)
instructions: All food accepted: meat, dairy, bones, fish, fruit, vegetables
Use compostable liner bags or newspaper
commonMistakes: Don't put food waste in garbage
Don't use plastic bags as liners

materials.name: Yard waste
instructions: Branches: cut to fit in bin or bundle (max 1.2m / 4 feet)
notes: Yard waste shares the green bin with food scraps
commonMistakes: Don't use plastic bags for yard waste

materials.name: Food-soiled paper
instructions: Food-soiled paper goes with organics, not recycling
commonMistakes: Don't put soiled paper in blue box

materials.name: Coffee grounds and filters
instructions: Paper filters and paper tea bags included
commonMistakes: Remove staples from tea bags if present

materials.name: Fruit and fruit scraps
notes: All fruit scraps go in green bin
commonMistakes: Don't put in garbage

materials.name: Vegetables and vegetable scraps
notes: All vegetable scraps go in green bin
commonMistakes: Don't put in garbage

materials.name: Meat and bones
notes: Vancouver green bin accepts all meat and bones
commonMistakes: Don't put in garbage

materials.name: Dairy products
instructions: Rinse and recycle container separately in blue box
notes: Expired dairy food goes in green bin
commonMistakes: Recycle the container separately

materials.name: Bread and grains
notes: All grain-based food goes in green bin
commonMistakes: Don't put in garbage

materials.name: Eggs and eggshells
instructions: Crush and place in green bin
commonMistakes: Don't put in garbage

materials.name: Chip bags and snack pouches
commonMistakes: Don't put in blue box

materials.name: Candy wrappers
commonMistakes: Don't put in blue box

materials.name: Receipts (thermal)
notes: Non-thermal paper receipts can go in blue box
commonMistakes: Don't put thermal receipts in blue box

materials.name: Diapers
commonMistakes: Don't put in green bin

materials.name: Pet waste
notes: Not accepted in green bin in Vancouver
commonMistakes: Don't put in green bin

materials.name: Plastic cutlery
commonMistakes: Don't put in blue box

materials.name: Plastic straws
commonMistakes: Don't put in blue box

materials.name: Wax paper and parchment paper
commonMistakes: Don't put in blue box or green bin

materials.name: Compostable plastics
instructions: NOT accepted in blue box or green bin in Vancouver curbside
notes: Despite labelling, compostable plastics contaminate both streams
commonMistakes: Don't put in blue box or green bin

materials.name: Mirrors, ceramics, and drinking glasses
instructions: Wrap safely and place in garbage
notes: Different melting point than bottle glass; contaminates glass recycling
commonMistakes: Don't put in blue box

materials.name: Batteries
instructions: Take to a Return-It depot or battery drop-off location
Tape terminals of lithium and 9V batteries
London Drugs, Home Depot, and Canadian Tire accept batteries
notes: Call2Recycle program handles battery recycling in BC
Batteries cause fires in garbage trucks
commonMistakes: Don't put in garbage or blue box

materials.name: Electronics / E-waste
instructions: Take to a Return-It electronics depot
Best Buy and London Drugs also accept e-waste
notes: BC has an electronics recycling regulation
commonMistakes: Don't put in garbage or blue box

materials.name: Paint
instructions: Take to a Product Care depot or Return-It location
notes: BC PaintRecycle program accepts leftover paint for free
commonMistakes: Don't pour down drain or put in garbage

materials.name: Medications
instructions: BC Medications Return Program at Shoppers Drug Mart, London Drugs, etc.
notes: Free take-back at pharmacies across BC
commonMistakes: Don't flush medications
Don't put in garbage

materials.name: Clothing and textiles
instructions: Donate to Salvation Army, Value Village, or clothing bins
notes: Worn-out textiles also accepted at some bins
commonMistakes: Don't put in garbage if reusable

materials.name: Light bulbs
instructions: CFL and fluorescent: take to a LightRecycle depot (Home Depot, IKEA, London Drugs)
LED and incandescent: wrap and garbage
commonMistakes: Don't put CFL or fluorescent in garbage

materials.name: Motor oil
instructions: Take to a BCUSED depot or auto parts store
Canadian Tire and auto shops accept used oil
notes: BC Used Oil Management Association handles recycling
commonMistakes: Don't pour down drain

materials.name: Propane tanks
instructions: Take to Vancouver South Transfer Station or a propane retailer
notes: Pressurized containers are dangerous in garbage trucks
commonMistakes: Never puncture or put in garbage

materials.name: Books
instructions: Donate if in good condition (Vancouver Public Library, thrift stores)
If damaged, place in blue box
commonMistakes: Don't throw usable books in garbage

materials.name: Pizza box
instructions: If heavily soiled with grease: green bin
notes: Greasy pizza boxes contaminate paper recycling
commonMistakes: Don't put greasy boxes in blue box

materials.name: Disposable coffee cups (paper, lined)
instructions: Lined paper cups not accepted in Vancouver curbside recycling
notes: The plastic lining makes them non-recyclable curbside
commonMistakes: Don't put in blue box; lined cups go in garbage in Vancouver

materials.name: Cooking oil and grease
instructions: Small amounts: pour onto newspaper and place in green bin
Large amounts: take to transfer station
commonMistakes: Don't pour down sink

materials.name: Needles and sharps
instructions: Take to a pharmacy or community health centre
notes: Never put loose sharps in any bin
commonMistakes: Never put in garbage or blue box

materials.name: Mattress
instructions: Take to Vancouver South Transfer Station
Or schedule a large item pickup through the city
commonMistakes: Don't leave at curb without scheduling

materials.name: Tires
instructions: Take to a tire retailer or Return-It depot
Most shops accept old tires with purchase
commonMistakes: Don't dump illegally

materials.name: Egg cartons
instructions: Foam egg cartons: take to Recycle BC depot
commonMistakes: Foam cartons must go to depot, not blue box

materials.name: Spray bottles (plastic)
commonMistakes: Don't include non-rigid/flexible containers

materials.name: Toothbrush
commonMistakes: Don't put in blue box

materials.name: Fast food wrappers
commonMistakes: Don't put greasy wrappers in blue box

materials.name: Fluorescent tubes
instructions: Take to a LightRecycle depot (Home Depot, IKEA, London Drugs)
commonMistakes: Don't put in garbage

materials.name: Chargers and cables
instructions: Take to a Return-It depot or Best Buy
commonMistakes: Don't put in blue box

materials.name: Smartphone / phone
instructions: Take to a Return-It depot or carrier store
commonMistakes: Don't forget to wipe data

materials.name: Sanitary products
commonMistakes: Don't put in green bin

materials.name: Rigid plastic household containers
commonMistakes: Don't include if it held hazardous material (motor oil, pesticides)

recycle: Plastic bottles, tubs, and rigid containers
compost: All food waste (meat, dairy, bones, fruit, vegetables)
Food-soiled paper (pizza boxes, napkins, paper towels)

tips: Flexible plastics and film must go to a Recycle BC depot — NOT in the blue box
Foam / styrofoam must go to a Recycle BC depot — NOT in the blue box
Flatten cardboard to max 76cm x 76cm (30" x 30")
Leave 1 metre between recycling and garbage bins for collection
Set out by 7 AM on collection day. GFL Environmental: 604-282-7966
Use the Recycle BC app or recyclebc.ca for material lookup
Greasy pizza boxes go in green bin, not blue box

locations.name: Vancouver South Transfer Station
locations.address: 377 W Kent Ave N, Vancouver, BC V5Y 0E5

locations.name: Recycle BC Depots
locations.notes: Multiple depot locations across Metro Vancouver; use recyclebc.ca to find nearest depot
